meanings.definition: Established as a custom or practice within an organization or society.
meanings.sent1: The institutionalized rules at the school were followed by all students.
meanings.sent2: The company had institutionalized procedures for handling customer complaints.
meanings.sent3: It became an institutionalized tradition to have a picnic every Friday.
meanings.sent4: The institutionalized way of greeting each other had been passed down for generations.
meanings.sent5: The institutionalized dress code made everyone look professional and neat.

meanings.definition: Committed to a mental institution for long-term care.
meanings.sent1: She felt scared when she was institutionalized in the hospital.
meanings.sent2: The patient was institutionalized after experiencing severe trauma.
meanings.sent3: Being institutionalized meant she had to follow a strict routine every day.
meanings.sent4: He felt relieved when he was institutionalized and received the help he needed.
meanings.sent5: The institutionalized environment provided a sense of safety and support.

meanings.definition: Made official or recognized by an institution.
meanings.sent1: The newly elected president was institutionalized in a grand ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The decision was institutionalized by the board of directors.
meanings.sent3: The award was institutionalized as a symbol of excellence in the field.
meanings.sent4: Her achievements were institutionalized through a prestigious scholarship.
meanings.sent5: The policy was institutionalized to ensure fairness and transparency.
